creator: diskusjonsforum@skriblerier.net
text:
While debugging a problem in my news management system, I came across a problem 
with Apache which seems to crash each time a specific SQL Query is run. Running 
the query directly into phpMyadmin works fine, but not in my script.

The query is simply: SELECT * FROM `ebanews_categories` WHERE `parent_id` = 0 
ORDER BY `id` DESC LIMIT 0 , 4 which should return 4 rows. The clue here is 
parent_id's value. If I set it to '', Apache doesn't crash.

(I'm not really sure what more information I can give at this point. Is is 
possible to create a crashlog or something?)

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
Neither PHP nor MySQL is part of Apache. Please open a bug report at php
(http://bugs.php.net/) or MySQL.
